author: S Prasad
text:
A week after the Model Code of Conduct came into force, a car belonging to a functionary of the ruling AINRC bearing the party flag was found parked near the Legislative Assembly creating a furore on Thursday.

Sources said the private car with the party flag and bearing the name plate vice-president of AINRC was found parked in front of the Legislative Assembly. However, police personnel at the Assembly failed to take note of the violation.

A group of onlookers noticed the violation and allegedly made complaints to the Election cell. However, officials at the control room established at the Collectorate said that they had not received any complaint related to code of conduct violations.
title: Ruling party member violates poll code
